# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)

function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
  words = split(str, "\s")
  wrapped_str = ""
  current_width = 0
  for word in words
    current_width += length(word) + 1  # Add space between words
    if current_width >= text_width
      wrapped_str .= join(words[1:end-1], "\n")  # Add new line before remaining words
      current_width = length(word) + 1
      wrapped_str .= word
    else
      wrapped_str .= word " "
      current_width += length(word) + 1
    end
  end
  wrapped_str .= "\n"  # Add final new line
  return wrapped_str
end

# Example
str = "This is a long string that will be wrapped to a maximum width of 10. It has many words and will be split into multiple lines."

wrap_string(str)

# Output
"""
This is a long string that will be wrapped to a maximum width of 10. It has many words and will be split into

multiple lines.
"""
```
